question: Mufti Uncle, my grandma says the we should not cut clothes or give broom on certain days, is is true
answer:
QUESTION

Assalam Walikum,

Mufti Uncle, my grandma says the we should not cut clothes or give broom on certain days, is is true

 

I do hijab and naqab and  i live with my brother-in-law, my husband does not listen to me if  i tell him..i have hard time...I really have difficult time...can i take my purda in fron of them! also tell me dua so my hiband will listen to me

 

Is there any dua to make my husband agree on adoption...(as his problem of no sperm)

 

We rarley get guest at our house is there any dua for it..

 

 

 

Jazakumallah kharyun

ANSWER


Share:

 

Assalamu Alaikum Warahmatullah

 

Brother/Sister in Islam

 

1)     There is no basis in Shariah for not cutting clothes or sweeping on certain days.

 

2)     It is compulsory for you to do Hijab in front of your brother in law. Your husband should be advised that you cannot listen to him and disobey Allah and his Rasul.

 

3)     You should discuss your wish of adoption with your husband. Make Dua to Allah that if adoption is good for you, then Allah must make the husband agree.

 

4)     If guests do not come to your house simply invite them.  

 

 

And Allah Knows Best

 

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
